title: The Spoils Of War
transcript:
JAIME LANNISTER: Halt that wagon!
JAIME LANNISTER: opens the carriage. It is filled with gold bars and coins. He picks up a large sack and hands it to BRONN.
BRONN: You just won the biggest prize in the world. What could you possibly have to be upset about? Come on. You can tell me. Queen of Thorns give you one last prick in the balls before saying goodbye?
JAIME LANNISTER: I'll save my confessions for the High Septon.
BRONN: There is no more High Septon.
JAIME LANNISTER: No, there isn't, is there?"
BRONN: There is still the question of my prize.
JAIME LANNISTER: is putting a padlock on the wagon bearing the gold. He stops and turns to BRONN.
JAIME LANNISTER: That's a lot of money I just gave you.
BRONN: It's not a castle.
BRONN: turns and points to Highgarden.
BRONN: How about that one? It's available.
JAIME LANNISTER: You don't want Highgarden.
BRONN: I beg to differ.
JAIME LANNISTER: We're at war. Daenerys Targaryen could come take it back the day after you move in. Besides, think of the upkeep. The more you own, the more it weighs you down."
BRONN: Oh, is that why you're so fucking glum, eh? All your new riches weighing you down?"
JAIME LANNISTER: pounds on the back of the carriage and the horses start trotting.
JAIME LANNISTER: They're not mine. The gold belongs to the Iron Bank. We pay our debts.
BRONN: Right. Just not to me.
JAIME LANNISTER: Bronn of the Blackwater, formerly of whatever nameless shit heap you're from with a saddlebag full of gold complaining about not getting paid. When we win this war all the castles in the Seven Kingdoms will be yours to choose from with no one left to take them away from you."
BRONN: Yes, I'm sure Queen Cersei's reign will be quiet and peaceful."
JAIME LANNISTER: Stranger things have happened.
BRONN: Like what?
RANDYLL: TARLEY and his son DICKON come riding up on horseback. RANDYLL addresses JAIME.
RANDYLL: The granaries are being emptied and loaded into wagons, My Lord."
JAIME LANNISTER: The current harvest?
DICKON: We have teams of men collecting it and more farmers in the Reach.
JAIME LANNISTER: looks over to BRONN.
JAIME LANNISTER: Ser Bronn, will you accompany the Tarleys and help them accelerate this process?"
BRONN: I'm not much for shoveling weight.
JAIME LANNISTER: No, but motivating reluctant farmers to hand over their harvest, I've heard you guys have a real talent for that."
RANDYLL: My Lord.
DICKON: My Lord.
RANDYLL: DICKON and BRONN break away from the Lannister army and ride into the distance. Horse drawn carts are carrying spoils from Highgarden and Lannister men are marching down the road.
CERSEI LANNISTER: and TYCHO NESTORIS from the Iron Bank of Braavos are sitting having a discussion.
TYCHO: I must say, I don't think the Iron Bank has ever had a debt of this magnitude repaid in a single installment. I always considered your father a very effective and efficient man, but you appear to be redefining those terms entirely."
CERSEI LANNISTER: You're too kind, My Lord."
TYCHO: I am neither kind, nor a lord, Your Grace. I am merely an instrument of the institution I represent, its wellbeing is a matter of arithmetic, not sentiment. And the current arithmetic is outstanding. The gold --"
CERSEI LANNISTER: Is on its way. My brother is supervising its transportation himself.
TYCHO: Some at the Iron Bank will be disappointed. They've grown rather fond of your interest payments.
CERSEI LANNISTER: We must devise a way to raise their spirits.
TYCHO: Yes. Perhaps we could be of assistance in some current venture.
CERSEI LANNISTER: My only venture at the moment is reestablishing control over this continent and every person on it.
TYCHO: I see a great deal of potential in that venture. I imagine that it would require outside investment?
CERSEI LANNISTER: It will indeed. I need to expand my armies, my navies. My hand, Qyburn, had made overtures to the Golden Company in Essos."
TYCHO: I know them well. They've helped us recover significant sums from parties who had fallen into deep arrears.
CERSEI LANNISTER: That's good to hear. I too would like them to recover some things that belong to me.
TYCHO: Rest assured, Your Grace, you can count on the Iron Bank's support, as soon as the gold arrives."
BRAN STARK: is sitting in a wheelchair. PETER BAELISH is sitting next to him. BAELISH unsheathes a Valyrian steel dagger and shows it to BRAN. It's the same dagger used in the attempt to assassinate BRAN years ago.
PETYR BAELISH: This is for you.
PETYR BAELISH: flips the knife in his hand and extends it towards BRAN.
PETYR BAELISH: The last man who wielded it meant to cut your throat, but your mother fought him off."
BRAN STARK: reaches out and takes the knife, turning it and looking it over carefully."
PETYR BAELISH: The other dagger, the one that took her life, I would have stopped that dagger with my own heart if I could have. I wasn't there for her when she needed me most. But I am here for her now. To do what she would have done, to protect her children. Anything I can do for you, Brandon, you need only ask."
BRAN STARK: Do you know who this belonged to?
PETYR BAELISH: No. That very question was what started the War of the Five Kings. In a way, that dagger made you what you are today. Forced from your home, driven out to the wilds beyond the Wall. I imagine you've seen things most men wouldn't believe."
PETYR BAELISH: hands the sheath of the knife to BRAN. BRAN slides the knife into the sheath.
PETYR BAELISH: To go through all of that and make your way home again only to find such chaos in the world, I can only imagine --"
BRAN STARK: Chaos is a ladder.
BRAN STARK: is staring at BAELISH. BAELISH stops speaking. The door opens and Meera appears.
PETYR BAELISH: I'm sorry to have disturbed you, Lord Stark."
PETYR BAELISH: stands up to leave.
BRAN STARK: I'm not Lord Stark.
PETYR BAELISH: bows and walks past Meera and closes the door.
MEERA: notices BRAN sitting in a wheelchair.
MEERA: What's that?
BRAN STARK: Maester Wolkan built it for me so I can move around more easily.
MEERA: It's a very good idea.
BRAN STARK: You're leaving?
MEERA: I don't want to leave you, but when they come I need to be with my family. And you're safe, safe as anyone can be now. You don't need me anymore."
BRAN STARK: No, I don't."
MEERA: That's all you've got to say?
BRAN STARK: Thank you.
MEERA: Thank you?
BRAN STARK: For helping me.
MEERA: My brother died for you. Hodor and Summer died for you. I almost died for you. Bran!
BRAN STARK: I'm not really, not anymore. I remember what it felt like to be Brandon Stark, but I remember so much else now."
MEERA: begins to cry.
MEERA: You died in that cave.
MEERA: turns to walk out the door. She hesitates looking at BRAN, then walks out."
ARYA STARK: approaches the main gate on foot. Two guards are huddled by a brazier getting warm. There's indistinct chatter. One of the men notice ARYA walking to the gate and approach her.
MAN: Hey, oh. Where are you going?"
ARYA STARK: In there. I live here.
MAN: Fuck off.
ARYA STARK: I'm Arya Stark. This is my home.
MAN: Arya Stark is dead.
ARYA STARK: Send for Maester Llewyn or Ser Rodrick. They'll tell you who I am.
MAN: There's no Rodrick here.
MAN: Maester's name is Wolkan.
ARYA STARK: Go ask Jon Snow then, the King in the North. He's my brother"
MAN: He's a thousand miles away.
MAN: It's cold. We're busy. So, you know, best fuck off."
MAN: Mm-hmm.
ARYA STARK: If Jon Snow is gone who is in charge of Winterfell?
MAN: The Lady of Winterfell, Lady Stark."
ARYA STARK: Which Lady Stark?
MAN: You tell us. You're the one impersonating her sister.
ARYA STARK: Tell Sansa her sister is home.
MAN: Lady Sansa is too busy to waster her breath on you, just like us. So for the last time, fuck off."
MAN: 1 goes to grab Arya but she easily dodges out of his grasp.
ARYA STARK: I'm getting into this castle one way or another. If I'm not who I say I am, I won't last long. But if I am, and Sansa finds out that you turned me away..."
ARYA STARK: keeps glancing at the men. They look uneasy. They bring her inside of the gate. They indicate towards a cart near the entrance.
MAN: You sit there. Right there. Don't move.
MAN: Go tell Lady Stark. I'll watch her.
ARYA STARK: is glancing around Winterfell. Men are working building tools and cutting wood. ARYA looks over and sees a Winterfell flag sigil hanging from the wall. The two guards are still arguing.
MAN: You tell her.
MAN: I'm not.
MAN: Because if you don't I'll hit you right in the fucking face as hard as I can.
MAN: We told her to wait. We were standing right next to her.
SANSA STARK: sighs.
MAN: When we turned around she had gone, My Lady. She was nothing. Some winter town girl."
MAN: She comes in asking for Ser Rodrick and Maester Llewyn.
MAN: Don't trouble yourself over it, My Lady. We'll find her."
SANSA STARK: You don't have to. I know where she is.
ARYA STARK: is standing look at a statue of Ned Stark holding his sword. ARYA hears a sound and turns to see SANSA approaching. SANSA stops when she sees ARYA.
ARYA STARK: Do I have to call you Lady Stark now?
SANSA STARK: hesitates for a moment.
SANSA STARK: Yes.
SANSA STARK: begins smiling then walking towards ARYA. SANSA reaches out and hugs ARYA.
SANSA STARK: You shouldn't have run from the guards.
ARYA STARK: I didn't run. You need better guards.
SANSA STARK: smirks at ARYA.
ARYA STARK: It suits you, Lady Stark. Jon left you in charge?"
SANSA STARK: He did. I hope he comes back soon. I remember how happy he was to see me. When he sees you, his heart will probably stop."
ARYA STARK: That doesn't look like him. It should have been carved by someone who knew his face.
SANSA STARK: Everyone who knew his face is dead.
ARYA STARK: We're not.
ARYA STARK: turns to face SANSA.
ARYA STARK: They say you killed Joffrey. Did you?
SANSA STARK: I wish I had.
ARYA STARK: Me too. I was angry when I heard someone else had done it. However long my list got he was always first.
SANSA STARK: Your list?
ARYA STARK: Of people I'm going to kill.
SANSA STARK: begins to laugh. ARYA joins her.
SANSA STARK: How did you get back to Winterfell?
ARYA STARK: It's a long story. I imagine yours is too.
SANSA STARK: Yes. It's not a very pleasant one.
ARYA STARK: Mine neither, but our stories aren't over yet."
SANSA STARK: No, they're not."
SANSA STARK: Arya, Bran's home too."
ARYA STARK: smiles and looks at SANSA. SANSA doesn't smile back. The smile fades from ARYA's face.
BRAN STARK: is sitting next to the Weirwood tree. SANSA and ARYA approach. BRAN turns to look at them. BRAN begins speaking to ARYA.
BRAN STARK: You came home.
ARYA STARK: steps forward and throws her arms around BRAN. SANSA smiles in the background. ARYA lets go and steps back.
BRAN STARK: I saw you at the crossroads.
ARYA STARK: You saw me?
BRAN STARK: I see quite a lot now.
SANSA STARK: Bran has visions.
BRAN STARK: I thought you might go to King's Landing.
ARYA STARK: So did I.
SANSA STARK: Why would you go back there?
BRAN STARK: Cersei is on her list of names.
ARYA STARK: stares at BRAN. ARYA turns to look at SANSA.
SANSA STARK: Who else is on your list?
ARYA STARK: Most of them are dead already.
BRAN STARK: produces the Valyrian dagger that BAELISH gave him and unsheathes it.
ARYA STARK: Where did you get this?
BRAN STARK: Littlefinger gave it to me.
ARYA STARK: Littlefinger, he's here?"
ARYA STARK: turns to look at SANSA.
SANSA STARK: He's declared for House Stark.
SANSA STARK: steps up closer to BRAN and speaks to him.
SANSA STARK: Why would he give you a dagger?
BRAN STARK: He thought I'd want it.
SANSA STARK: Why?
BRAN STARK: Because it was meant to kill me.
SANSA STARK: The cutthroat after your fall?
ARYA STARK: Why would a cutthroat have a Valyrian steel dagger?
BRAN STARK: Someone very wealthy wanted me dead.
SANSA STARK: He's not a generous man. He wouldn't give you anything unless he thought he was getting something back.
BRAN STARK: It doesn't matter.
SANSA STARK: What do you mean it doesn't matter?
BRAN STARK: I don't want it.
BRAN STARK: holds the knife out to ARYA. ARYA looks at BRAN.
ARYA STARK: Are you sure? It's Valyrian steel.
BRAN STARK: It's wasted on a cripple.
ARYA STARK: looks down at the dagger. She steps forward and takes it from BRAN.
ARYA STARK: is pushing BRAN in his wheelchair and SANSA is next to them. The Stark children are walking back through the gate of Winterfell. Men are milling around doing various jobs. BRIENNE and PODRICK see the Stark children all back at Winterfell together.
PODRICK: Catelyn Stark would be proud. You kept your vow.
BRIENNE: I did next to nothing.
PODRICK: You're too hard on yourself, My Lady."
BRIENNE: I'm not a --
BRIENNE: pauses for a moment.
BRIENNE: Thank you, Podrick."
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: and MISSANDEI are walking along a path outside of Dragonstone followed by members of the Queensguard.
MISSANDEI: Your Grace, there's still no word from the Unsullied."
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: Soon. They will come back to me.
MISSANDEI: He better.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: stops and turns to look at MISSANDEI. She then continues walking.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: What happened?
MISSANDEI: begins smirking.
MISSANDEI: Many things.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: Many things?
JON SNOW: Your Grace.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: looks at MISSANDEI then her Queensguard. She speaks in Valyrian and motions to her guard to stand down.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: It's all right.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: descends the stairs with MISSANDEI and they begin walking with JON. They walk along the beach until they reach a cave. DAVOS is waiting for them with a lit torch.
JON SNOW: I wanted you to see it before we start hacking it to bits.
JON SNOW: leads DAENERYS and MISSANDEI into the cave. He lights a brazier and illuminates the Dragonglass along the walls. He continues walking deeper into the cave.
JON SNOW: So this is it, all we'll ever need."
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: is looking up at the walls of Dragonglass.
JON SNOW: There is something else I want to show your, Your Grace."
JON SNOW: and DAENERYS go to a further chamber in the cave. There are murals painted on the walls of Dragonglass.
JON SNOW: The Children of the Forest made these.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: When?
JON SNOW: A very long time ago.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: They were right here standing where we're standing before there were Targaryens or Starks or Lannisters. Maybe even before there were men.
JON SNOW: No.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: stops looking at the walls and turns to look at JON. JON walks to another wall and begins to examine the murals. The murals depict Children of the Forest and the First Men standing together.
JON SNOW: They were here together the Children and the First Men.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: Doing what? Fighting each other?
JON SNOW: takes DAENERYS by the arm and swings her torch to another part of the wall. There is a mural of the Night King and White Walkers.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: They fought together against their common enemy. Despite their differences, despite their suspicions, together. We need to do the same if we're going to survive."
JON SNOW: and DAENERYS look back at the wall with the Night King.
JON SNOW: Because the enemy is real. It's always been real.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: turns to look at JON.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: And you say you can't defeat them without my armies and my dragons?
JON SNOW: No, I don't think I can."
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: steps forward closer to JON.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: I will fight for you. I will fight for the north...when you bend the knee.
JON SNOW: My people won't accept a southern ruler, not after everything they've suffered."
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: steps even closer to JON until they're face to face.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: They will if their king does. They chose you to lead them. They chose you to protect them. Isn't their survival more important than your pride?
JON SNOW: and DAENERYS, DAVOS and MISSANDEI are walking out of the cave. As they exit TYRION and VARYS are standing on the beach awaiting them. DAENERYS begins addressing Tyrion."
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: What is it?
TYRION LANNISTER: We took Casterly Rock.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: That's very good to hear.
TYRION LANNISTER: and VARYS look at each other. They aren't eager to deliver the bad news.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: Isn't it?
DAVOS: You'll want to discuss this amongst yourselves. Perhaps --
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: You will stay. All my allies are gone. They've been taken from me while I've been sitting here on this island.
TYRION LANNISTER: We still have the largest army.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: Who won't be able to eat because Cersei has taken all the food from the Reach.
TYRION LANNISTER: Call Grey Worm and the Unsullied back. We still have enough ships to carry the Dothraki to the mainland. Commit to the blockade of King's Landing. We have a plan. It's still the right plan.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: stops walking, turns and speaks harshly to Tyrion."
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: The right plan? Your strategy has lost us Dorne, the Iron Islands and the Reach."
TYRION LANNISTER: If I've underestimated our enemies --
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: Our enemies? Your family, you mean. Perhaps you don't want to hurt them after all."
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: begins looking out to the ocean. Three dragons are flying in the sky over the water.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: Enough with the clever plans.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: turns back and looks at TYRION.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: I have three large dragons. I'm going to fly them to the Red Keep.
TYRION LANNISTER: We've discussed this.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: My enemies are in the Red Keep. What kind of a queen am I if I'm not willing to risk my life to fight them?
TYRION LANNISTER: A smart one.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: looks over to JON SNOW.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: What do you think I should do?
JON SNOW: I would never presume to --
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: I'm at war. I'm losing.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: begins walking close to JON.
JON SNOW: looks over the ocean at the dragons flying.
JON SNOW: I never thought that dragons would exist again. No one did. The people who follow you know that you made something impossible happen. Maybe that helps them believe that you can make other impossible things happen. Build a world that's different from the shit one they've always known.
JON SNOW: glances back towards the dragons.
JON SNOW: But if you use them to melt castles and burn cities, you're not different. You're just more of the same."
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: looks back out to her dragons flying along the water.
BRIENNE: and PODRICK are sparring. BRIENNE kicks PODS foot out from under him and he lands face first in the dirt.
BRIENNE: Don't lunge.
PODRICK: pushes himself back up and picks up his sword. PODRICK attacks again. Brienne blocks his blows and kicks his foot out again.
BRIENNE: Don't go where your enemy leads you.
ARYA STARK: is watching the sparring session from across the courtyard. She begins to approach Brienne.
BRIENNE: Up.
BRIENNE: begins striking at PODRICK while he blocks her blows. BRIENNE hits PODRICK in the stomach with the hilt of her sword and PODRICK lands on the ground.
BRIENNE: And don't --
ARYA STARK: Don't fight someone like her in the first place.
PODRICK: stands up and retrieves his sword. ARYA walks closer to speak to BRIENNE.
BRIENNE: Nice sword. Very nice dagger.
ARYA STARK: looks down at the Valyrian dagger and unsheathes it. She approaches BRIENNE flipping the knife several times in her fingers. BRIENNE takes the dagger and examines it.
SANSA STARK: and BAELISH are walking along the upper section of the courtyard having a conversation.
SANSA STARK: If they haven't contributed the right amount of grain to the stores then I'm afraid they'll have to make due with --
SANSA STARK: sees ARYA in the courtyard speaking with BRIENNE and stops to watch her.
ARYA STARK: It's been awhile since I've trained.
BRIENNE: I can go and find the Master of Arms for you, My Lady."
ARYA STARK: He didn't beat the hound. You did. I want to train with you.
BRIENNE: chuckles.
ARYA STARK: You swore to serve both of my mother's daughters, didn't you?"
BRIENNE: nods her head in agreement.
BRIENNE: Move aside, Podrick."
PODRICK: backs away. ARYA draws her sword, Needle."
BRIENNE: You can't use that, My Lady. It's too small."
ARYA STARK: I won't cut you. Don't worry.
BRIENNE: smirks and raises her sword to a fighting posture.
BRIENNE: I'll try not to.
BRIENNE: strikes at ARYA who quickly sidesteps and parries the attack. BRIENNE attacks again and ARYA sidesteps, dodges multiple strikes and parries BRIENNE while smiling. ARYA strikes at BRIENNE and hits her hand causing BRIENNE to flinch and lose her two-handed grip on her sword. BRIENNE regains composure and starts to circle ARYA. BAELISH and SANSA are still watching from the upper balcony. ARYA is waiting for an attack with her sword behind her back. BRIENNE strikes and ARYA blocks her attacks, spins and stabs behind her back and hits BRIENNE in the knee causing BRIENNE's sword to strike the dirt. BRIENNE kicks ARYA in the stomach and sends ARYA to the ground. ARYA quickly gets back to her feet. BRIENNE overpowers ARYA and ARYA drops her sword on the ground. BRIENNE strikes again but ARYA dodges, draws her Valyrian dagger and puts it near BRIENNE's neck. BRIENNE and ARYA both stop fighting and sheathe their weapons smiling."
BRIENNE: Who taught you to do that?
ARYA STARK: No one.
ARYA STARK: collects her sword. SANSA walks away. BAELISH remains on the balcony staring at ARYA who looks up at him. BAELISH bows to ARYA and walks away.
JON SNOW: and DAVOS are walking along the paths outside of Dragonstone having a discussion.
DAVOS: What do you think of her?
JON SNOW: Who?
DAVOS: sighs
DAVOS: I believe you know of whom I speak.
JON SNOW: I think she has a good heart.
DAVOS: A good heart? I've noticed you starring at that good heart.
JON SNOW: There's no time for that. I saw the Night King, Davos. I looked into his eyes. How many men do we have in the north to fight him? 10,000? Less?"
DAVOS: Fewer.
JON SNOW: What?
DAVOS: and JON near the end of the path. MISSANDEI is standing along the path looking at the ocean.
DAVOS: Speaking of good hearts, Missandei of Naarth."
MISSANDEI: turns to looks at DAVOS and JON.
MISSANDEI: Ser Davos, Lord Snow."
DAVOS: King Snow, isn't it? No? That doesn't sound right. King Jon?"
JON SNOW: It doesn't matter.
MISSANDEI: Forgive me, but may I ask a question?"
JON SNOW: Of course.
MISSANDEI: Your name is Jon Snow, but your father's name was Ned Stark?"
JON SNOW: I'm a bastard. My mother and father weren't married.
DAVOS: Is the custom different in Naarth?
MISSANDEI: We don't have marriage in Naarth so the concept of a bastard doesn't exist.
DAVOS: The sounds liberating.
JON SNOW: Why did you leave your homeland?
MISSANDEI: I was stolen away by slavers.
JON SNOW: I'm sorry.
DAVOS: If I may, how did a slave girl come to advise Daenerys Targaryen?"
MISSANDEI: She bought me from my master and set me free.
DAVOS: That was good of her. Of course you're serving her now, aren't you?"
MISSANDEI: I serve my queen because I want to serve my queen. Because I believe in her.
JON SNOW: And if you wanted to sail home to Naarth tomorrow --
MISSANDEI: Then she would give me a ship and wish me good fortune.
JON SNOW: You believe that?
MISSANDEI: I know it. All of us who came with her from Essos, we believe in her. She's not our queen because she's the daughter of some king we never knew. She's the queen we chose."
DAVOS: You'll forgive me if I switch sides.
JON SNOW: notices a single ship sailing into the bay. It has a kraken sigil. MISSANDEI turns to look.
JON SNOW: Is that a Greyjoy ship?
THEON GREYJOY: GREYJOY and other Iron Born are pulling their landing boat onto the beach wading through the surf. They pull the boat onto the sand. JON SNOW, MISSANDEI, DAVOS and Dothraki guards are waiting to meet them. JON sees THEON and both men freeze and stare at each other. JON steps forward towards THEON."
THEON GREYJOY: Jon. I didn't know you were here.
THEON GREYJOY: steps closer to JON.
THEON GREYJOY: Sansa, is she all right?"
JON SNOW: grabs THEON by his shirt and pulls him face to face.
JON SNOW: What you did for her is the only reason I'm not killing you.
JON SNOW: releases THEON.
DAVOS: We heard your uncle attacked your fleet. We thought you were dead.
THEON GREYJOY: I should be.
DAVOS: Your sister?
THEON GREYJOY: Euron has her. I came to ask the queen to help get her back.
JON SNOW: The queen is gone.
THEON GREYJOY: Where did she go?
RANDYLL: All of the gold is safely through the gates of King's Landing.
JAIME LANNISTER: Good.
RANDYLL: We need to get the last of these wagons over the Blackwater Rush before nightfall. If the head of the line is ambushed, the tail will never be able to reinforce in time."
JAIME LANNISTER: We are stretched a bit thin.
RANDYLL: With your permission, flogging stragglers has a marked effect on mobility."
JAIME LANNISTER: Let's give them fair warning first. These men fought well at Highgarden.
RANDYLL: is clearly disappointed. He turns and rides off back to the line of soldiers. JAIME and BRONN exchange glances, then follow RANDYLL. BRONN and JAIME are riding through the ranks. DICKON TARLEY sees JAIME and starts a conversation."
DICKON: Ser Jaime.
JAIME LANNISTER: Rickon.
DICKON: Dickon.
BRONN: openly laughs in DICKON's face and looks at JAIME.
JAIME LANNISTER: I hear you fought bravely at Highgarden. Your first battle?
DICKON: nods his head in agreement.
JAIME LANNISTER: And?
DICKON: It was glorious.
BRONN: Come on. Your father's not here.
DICKON: All my life we've been pledged to House Tyrell. I knew some of those men. I hunted with them.
JAIME LANNISTER: They didn't deserve to die. But Lady Olenna chose to betray the queen and support the Targaryen girl. So here we are.
DICKON: I didn't expect it to smell like that.
BRONN: Men shit themselves when they die. Didn't they teach you that at fancy lad school?
JAIME LANNISTER: looks over at BRONN
BRONN: Well, I learned it when I was 5."
BRONN: pauses and strains to hear a noise far in the distance.
JAIME LANNISTER: What?
BRONN: Listen.
JAIME LANNISTER: Spears and shields! Spears and shields!
JAIME LANNISTER: Spears and shields!
BRONN: In line now!
RANDYLL: is riding across the battlefield yelling orders to men.
RANDYLL: Come on, lads. Not those wagons. Fall in line. Fall in line."
DICKON: draws his sword. RANDYLL is yelling orders to the men.
RANDYLL: Spears armed!
BRONN: Get back to King's Landing.
JAIME LANNISTER: I'm not abandoning my army.
BRONN: You're a commander, not a damned infantryman. These fuckers are about to swamp us."
JAIME LANNISTER: We can hold them off.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: Dracarys!
DROGON: breathes fire into the first line of Lannister soldiers. The men burst into flames and start screaming. DICKON looks on in shock. A flanking group of Dothraki Screamers ride over the flames through the hole created by Drogon and start cutting men down. JAIME attempts to issue orders to the men.
JAIME LANNISTER: Hold the line!
JAIME LANNISTER: Archers! Archers with me!
JAIME LANNISTER: Knock!
ARCHERS: Knock! Draw!
DROGON: loops around and is making a pass on JAIME and the archers. DAENERYS and DROGON are diving at the group of men.
JAIME LANNISTER: Loose!
JAIME LANNISTER: Qyburn's scorpion is over there.
BRONN: Go get it then.
JAIME LANNISTER: I can't shoot with one hand.
JAIME LANNISTER: holds up his gold hand to illustrate his point.
BRONN: hesitates for a moment. He turns his horse and rides to man the artillery crossbow. JAIME draws his sword and rides into battle.
JAIME LANNISTER: Come on!
BRONN: Where are you?
TYRION LANNISTER: walks to the edge of the battlefield accompanied by Dothraki guards. He can see Lannisters being slaughtered. One of the Dothraki guards begin to speak.
GUARD: Your people can't fight.
TYRION LANNISTER: is watching the mayhem. Men are screaming and engulfed in flames. Horses and carriages run wild with no driver. JAIME is still on the battlefield struggling against the horde. Burning Lannister men are taking off their helmets revealing melted faces. Men crawl to the river in search of relief from the dragonfire. DROGON and DAENERYS are flying over the river creating wake in the water. JAIME sees her approaching his position.
JAIME LANNISTER: Take cover!
DROGON: spits flames into the Lannister position. The men standing there are reduced to standing ash. The wind blows them away. BRONN is lining up DROGON in the sights of the crossbow. He reaches down and pulls the lever to fire. A bolt sails past DROGON and misses. BRONN reloads the machine. DROGON and DAENERYS circle around and dive on the crossbow. BRONN takes his time aiming his shot.
BRONN: Come on you fucker.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: commands DROGON to fire at the crossbow.
TYRION LANNISTER: Flee, you idiot!"
JAIME LANNISTER: looks at DAENERYS and readies himself. He spurs his horse onward.
JAIME LANNISTER: Come on, boy. Come on!"
JAIME LANNISTER: grabs the spear as he rides by and brings it up to position. JAIME's horse is galloping full speed on the edge of the river kicking up water. TYRION is watching JAIME's attempt to kill DAENERYS.
TYRION LANNISTER: You fucking idiot.
JAIME LANNISTER: is getting close. DAENERYS turns at the last moment to see JAIME bearing down on her spear in hand. DROGON notices JAIME, turns his head and spews flames. BRONN appears from nowhere and manages to dive off of his horse and knock JAIME and himself in the water before they're both consumed by fire. Their horses are instantly burned to death. JAIME is being dragged down by a full set of armor into the dark water. JAIME sinks into blackness and out of sight."
